summary: The module provides a discrete diffusion scheduler based on the KDPM2 algorithm with ancestral sampling. It supports multiple configurable noise schedules (linear, scaled, Karras, exponential, beta), handles different prediction types (epsilon, sample, v-prediction), and includes utilities for initializing timesteps, adding noise, scaling model inputs, and performing a single denoising step.
business_intent: Enable flexible and efficient inference of diffusion models by offering a configurable KDPM2 ancestral discrete scheduler, facilitating high-quality image generation and research experimentation across various schedule and prediction configurations.
